often talked about in negative terms.
However, it also shows
positive aspects. In England, climate change has
helped a species of tree that is threatened with
extinction grow
well. The se qua tree, called Red Sam,
is 90 meters tall and lives up to 3,000 years.
From the American state of California,
this tree was introduced to England in the mid-
19th century and quickly developed until
now, it is estimated that there are about half a
million of these trees in the UK while in the US there
are only 80,000
sequa trees left.  In my opinion, there are two reasons why the
sequa tree thrives in England. The
